steps.title: Check Physical Connection
steps.instruction: Please check if your Ethernet cable is properly plugged into both your computer and the wall port/switch. try unplugging and replugging it until you hear a click.

steps.title: Check IP Address
steps.instruction: Open a terminal/command prompt and run `ipconfig` (Windows) or `ifconfig` (Mac/Linux). Check if you have a valid IP address (starts with 10.x, 192.x, or 172.x).

steps.title: Restart Network Adapter
steps.instruction: Go to Network Settings, disable your Ethernet adapter, wait 10 seconds, and enable it again.

steps.title: Ping Gateway
steps.instruction: Try to ping your default gateway. Run `ping <gateway_ip>` in your terminal.

steps.title: Restart Computer
steps.instruction: If all else fails, a simple restart can often fix network driver issues.
